Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that "Operation Lone Star" is specifically aimed at finishing the border wall, when in fact it is focused on combating smuggling and human trafficking.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that Texas has launched "Operation Lone Star" to finish the border wall.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that President Joe Biden suspended construction on new barriers along the U.S.-Mexico border, leaving the fate of contracts to build nearly 300 miles of barrier unclear.
Understate: The claim understates the complexity and challenges involved in constructing a border wall, as evidenced by the limited progress made under former President Donald Trump.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that Texas may have other motives for launching "Operation Lone Star" and may not be solely focused on finishing the border wall.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the role of Texas in finishing the border wall, as it does not provide enough evidence to support this assertion.
Falters at times: The claim falters in accurately representing the purpose and scope of "Operation Lone Star" and its connection to the border wall.
